materials.raw_text: Co: 20 g, Fe: 40 g, Tc: 10 g, Ti: 80 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Fe: Local metal suppliers or scrap yards; Tc: Specialized chemical suppliers; Ti: Metal suppliers or online marketplaces.
steps: Co: Metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Fe: Local metal suppliers or scrap yards; Tc: Specialized chemical suppliers; Ti: Metal suppliers or online marketplaces.

1. Measure each metal component using an analytical balance for precision. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, add Co, Fe, Tc, and Ti in the specified amounts. 3. Use a mechanical mixer to thoroughly mix the powders for at least 15 minutes to ensure uniform distribution of materials.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each metal component using an analytical balance for precision. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, add Co, Fe, Tc, and Ti in the specified amounts. 3. Use a mechanical mixer to thoroughly mix the powders for at least 15 minutes to ensure uniform distribution of materials.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible suitable for high-temperature processing. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1200째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible suitable for high-temperature processing. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1200째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of components.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Do not open the furnace during the cooling process to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Do not open the furnace during the cooling process to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified alloy and inspect for any surface imperfections. 3. Use a grinding tool to sand down rough edges and achieve desired dimensions. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface against oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified alloy and inspect for any surface imperfections. 3. Use a grinding tool to sand down rough edges and achieve desired dimensions. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface against oxidation.
